revised_title: Structural and Mechanistic Comparison of Pyridoxal 5'-Phosphate Dependent Enzymes
tldr: This article compares the structure and mechanism of pyridoxal 5'-phosphate dependent enzymes, specifically focusing on decarboxylation and transamination reactions. The author discusses the role of active site residues, such as histidine and lysine, in controlling the chemistry of the coenzyme. Stereochemical and kinetic techniques are used to analyze the reactions, providing insights into the catalytic processes of these enzymes.
